meanings.definition: A steep bank or slope, especially at the edge of a plateau or separating areas of land at different heights.
meanings.sent1: The hikers carefully climbed the scarp to reach the top of the hill.
meanings.sent2: The scarp along the river provided a beautiful view of the valley below.
meanings.sent3: The sheep tried to jump over the scarp, but ended up rolling down playfully.
meanings.sent4: The scarp stood tall like a giant wall, dividing the fields on either side.
meanings.sent5: The scarp loomed over the landscape, casting a shadow over the valley.

meanings.definition: To cut or make a steep bank or slope in (a piece of land).
meanings.sent1: The construction workers had to scarp the hill to build the new road.
meanings.sent2: They decided to scarp the land to create a terraced garden.
meanings.sent3: The kids pretended to scarp the sandcastle with their toy shovels.
meanings.sent4: The artist's brush seemed to scarp the canvas, creating bold strokes of color.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor used a chisel to scarp intricate patterns into the marble.
